H0.text: Electromagnet is a good material for wrapping copper wire, which is often wrapped in plastic.

H1.text: Insulator is a good plastic material for wrapping copper wire.

H2.text: Circuit is a good plastic material that copper wire is often wrapped in.

H3.text: Current is a good plastic material for wrapping copper wire.

A4.text: Flexible insulating materials such as PVC (polyvinyl chloride) are used to insulate the circuit and prevent human contact with a 'live' wire â€“ one having voltage of 600 volts or less.

A5.text: Sheath insulators are commonly made out of epoxy, due to its longevity and low conductivity.
